svcproc.title: ALIGNMENT
svcproc.para: Proper steering wheel-to-steering gear alignment is designed into the steering assembly. The following are a few alignment points to check at assembly or when steering wheel alignment is a problem.

step1.para: Test drive the vehicle on a straight and level (no crown) section of road for at least one quarter of a mile. Determine if or how far off center the steering wheel is when the vehicle is going straight.

If the steering wheel alignment is off, return the vehicle to the work area for further adjustment. Stop the vehicle with front road wheels (not the steering wheel) straight ahead as indicated by the test drive.
Proper steering wheel-to-steering gear alignment can be accomplished by removing the ering wheel and repositioning it on the upper steering column shaft.
Test drive the vehicle to assure that proper alignment has been accomplished and that steering is correct.
